page.title: 04Folklore of Strathmiglo
page.content: In 1715,after the battle of Sherriffmuir,Rob Roy invaded the countryside around Falkland and with his soldiers took over Falkland Palace. One of the most beautiful girls in the area was Jenny Nettles. One of Rob Roy's officers fell in love with her.When the time came for Rob Roy and his men to leave,the young officer deserted Jenny.Poor Jenny was broken hearted.She couldn't bear to live any longer so she committed suicide and was found hanging on a roadside tree between Falkland and Strathmiglo.Because she had committed suicide she couldn't be buried in the local graveyard,she could not even be put in a coffin, and sometime in the night she was buried on Barrington Moor.It is said that on moonlight nights,Jenny wanders over the moors searching for her lost love.
